# Best Bluetooth headphones 2020: Top on-ear or over-ear wireless headphones

![](//cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/200x/assets/images/phpnsdilr.jpg)[Mike
Lowe](/info/authors/mike-lowe)[![](https://cdn.pocket-
lint.com/bundles/pocketlintapp/images/envelop.png)](mailto:) · 30 March 2020 ·

Analysis Interpretation of the news based on evidence, including data;
projecting how events might unfold based on past events.

Sony ![Best Bluetooth headphones 2020: Top on-ear or over-ear wireless
headphones](https://cdn.pocket-
lint.com/r/s/320x/assets/images/138771-headphones-buyer-s-guide-best-
bluetooth-headphones-2019-top-on-ear-or-over-ear-wireless-headphones-
image1-bcdyijgl39.jpg?v1)

## \- We pick out the best over-ear headphones you'll find

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.pocket-
lint.com%2Fheadphones%2Fbuyers-guides%2F138771-best-bluetooth-headphones-top-

[Twitter](https://www.twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Best%20Bluetooth%20headphones%202020%3A%20Top%20on-
ear%20or%20over-ear%20wireless%20headphones&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.pocket-
lint.com%2Fheadphones%2Fbuyers-guides%2F138771-best-bluetooth-headphones-top-

[Pintrest](https://www.pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.pocket-
lint.com%2Fheadphones%2Fbuyers-guides%2F138771-best-bluetooth-headphones-top-

ear%20or%20over-ear%20wireless%20headphones&media=%2F%2Fcdn.pocket-
lint.com%2Fr%2Fs%2F748x%2Fassets%2Fimages%2F138771-headphones-buyer-s-guide-
best-bluetooth-headphones-2019-top-on-ear-or-over-ear-wireless-headphones-
image1-bcdyijgl39.jpg)
[LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.pocket-

rated-wireless-headphones-to-
buy&title=Best%20Bluetooth%20headphones%202020%3A%20Top%20on-ear%20or%20over-
ear%20wireless%20headphones)
[Mail](mailto:?subject=Best%20Bluetooth%20headphones%202020%3A%20Top%20on-
ear%20or%20over-ear%20wireless%20headphones&body=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.pocket-
lint.com%2Fheadphones%2Fbuyers-guides%2F138771-best-bluetooth-headphones-top-
rated-wireless-headphones-to-buy)

Bluetooth is no longer an inferior option for headphone sound quality. With
the advent of newer devices and more sophisticated audio processing and
transmission, there are plenty of Bluetooth headphones that will serve you
well, without the need for wires.

There's plenty of variety with these cans, whether you're looking for on-ear
or over-ear, so browse our selection and see what your next wireless
headphones should be. Here's our pick of the best.

  * [If in-ear headphones are more you then check out our other feature](/headphones/buyers-guides/140865-best-in-ear-headphones-top-wireless-and-wired-earbuds-and-earphones-to-buy)

## Best Bluetooth headphones for travel

Pocket-lint

### Bose Noise Cancelling Headphones 700

squirrel_widget_158195

Following the success of the earlier QC35, the newer Bose 700 over-ears really
step things up a gear. A seamless design, superb noise-cancelling to cut out
external sound, and loud and proud sound quality without the need for wires (a
backup 2.5-3.5mm cable is included in the carry case though). The battery life
lasts for about 18 hours a go too, making these our go-to over-ear headphones
for travelling. There's no better optin.

  * [Read our Bose NC 700 review](/headphones/reviews/bose/148533-bose-smart-nc-headphones-700-review-noise-cancelling)

Pocket-lint

### Sony WH-1000XM3

squirrel_widget_145585

Sony has created the other best noise-cancelling over-ear headphones that
we've tested. The 1000XM3 are particularly clever with noise-cancelling,
offering various modes to allow voice to pass through (or not). They can even
assess pressure to apply the perfect profile when on a plane, making them
excellent travel headphones. Bluetooth support for aptX HD means the utmost
quality without wires, but when the 30 hour battery runs dead you can still
plug in and listen passively with decent results.

  * [Read our Sony 1000X Mark 3 review](/headphones/reviews/sony/145585-sony-wh-1000xm3-review)

## Best Bluetooth headphones under £100

Pocket-lint

### Urbanista Seattle Wireless

squirrel_widget_142418

If you're working on a modest budget then Urbanista has a great value
proposition in the Seattle Wireless. We can't think of much better Bluetooth-
equipped cans under the £100 bar. Sure, you won't get aptX HD or noise-
cancellation like many of the pricier alternatives below, but the Seattle
Wireless are small, portable, kick out enough bass and are well designed.

  * [Read our Seattle Wireless review](/headphones/reviews/142418-urbanista-seattle-wireless-review-an-affordable-on-ear-ace)

## Best Bluetooth headphones under £200

Pocket-lint

### Audio-Technica ATH-M50xBT

squirrel_widget_148835

Price-wise, these headphones represent excellent value. They have a lot of
clout, while there's excellent balance and precision, too. They're also
comfortable to wear for long periods and they have excellent battery life.

Our only quibble is that they're physically quite big so are much more suited
for a home environment - you'll probably find them a little large for
travelling about. The design is, therefore, a little dated. We also miss noise
cancelling, but then if they had that, they'd be more expensive as a result.

[Read our Audio-Technica ATH-M50xBT review](/headphones/reviews/audio-
technica/148161-audio-technica-ath-m50xbt-headphones-review-bluetooth)

## Best Bluetooth headphones for Apple users

Pocket-lint

### Beats Solo Pro

squirrel_widget_168538

You don't have to have a bevy of Apple devices to make the most from these
cans, but the Solo Pro's inclusion of the H1 chip means seamless pairing with
your iPhone, iPad and Mac, without needing to fiddle around to get that
wireless connection. The Solo Pro also sound great, so if you're looking for a
pair of on-ear headphones - which arguably aren't as long-term comfy as an
over-ear solution - then the Beats is a great option.

  * [Read our Beats Solo Pro review](/headphones/reviews/beats/149369-beats-solo-pro-review)

## Best Bluetooth headphones for bass

Pocket-lint

### B&O BeoPlay H9i

squirrel_widget_145722

It would be too easy to criticise the B&O BeoPlay H9 for the high price and
the noise-cancellation being too subtle for some. But that would be
shortsighted: because the H9i is a killer over-ear headphone. Indeed, the
audio quality is immense, with punchy bass levels and a wide soundstage thanks
to those giant earcups. The downside is Bluetooth doesn't last as long as the
competition (but there is a 3.5mm jack for passive wired listening) and the
noise-cancelling isn't going to please frequent flyers for its subtlety.

  * [Read our BeoPlay H9i review](/headphones/reviews/145722-beoplay-h9i-review-headphones)

Pocket-lint

### Beats Studio 3 Wireless

squirrel_widget_142148

The Studio 3 Wireless might not suit the audiophile – c'mon, everyone knows
Beats is renowned for bass – but for everyone else these over-ear cans are
very easy to recommend. Especially for Apple users, thanks to the integrated
W1 chip and its easy pairing which allows for immediate cross-device ease-of-
use between iPhone, iPad and Mac. Even if you're not an iPhone user, the
ultra-long battery life, attractive and comfortable design, and serious sound
quality (and, yep, masses of bass) makes these Beats standout beyond much of
the over-ear competition.

  * [Read our Beats Studio 3 Wireless review](/headphones/reviews/beats/142148-beats-studio-3-wireless-review-smart-sounding-ultra-long-lasting-headphones)

Pocket-lint

### V-Moda Crossfade 2 Wireless Codex Edition

squirrel_widget_145881

As much as we liked the original, the latest 'Codex Edition' Crossfade 2
Wireless adds aptX for high quality Bluetooth and it knocks it out the park
when it comes tyo impactful low-end bass. The industrial design makes them
standout compared to the competition, however there's no active noise-
cancellation and the design is a tad pinchy compared to some.

  * [Read our V-Moda Crossfade Wireless 2 Codex review](/headphones/reviews/145881-v-moda-crossfade-wireless-2-codex-review)

Pocket-lint

### Sennheiser Momentum Wireless3

squirrel_widget_166842

These noise-cancelling wireless headphones come packed with plenty of smarts
and high-end features, and look great thanks to being made from high-end
materials. The large size of the earcups means great comfort, but, obviously,
significant physical size.

  * [Read our Sennheiser Momentum Wireless review](/headphones/reviews/sennheiser/149241-sennheiser-momentum-3-review-headphones-over-ear)

## Most unique Bluetooth headphones

Pocket-lint

### Nuraphone

squirrel_widget_144348

Ok, so they're not strictly just over-ear, because the Nura combines in-ear
fittings within the over-ear earcups. It's a unique design, but one with
purpose: it makes for tailored sound, as these cans can read the shape of your
ears and adjust the sound profile accordingly. They look weird, they feel
rather strange to wear, but the sound quality is from another planet.

  * [Read our Nuraphones review](/headphones/reviews/144348-nuraphone-headphone-review-price-sound-quality)

## Best Bluetooth headphones for audiophiles

Pocket-lint

### Audio-Technica ATH-DSR9BT

squirrel_widget_139169

Truly high-end Bluetooth-only headphones, the DSR9BT is designed for the
audiophile listener who doesn't want any wire-based nonsense. Indeed, there's
no 3.5mm jack to be found here. Ultra-comfortable to wear, these A-T over-ears
are designed unlike any other headphones on the market, featuring what Audio-
Technica calls a Dnote chipset, which commands four voice coils in the
headphones' 45mm drivers for optimum dynamics and clarity. And they really do
sound amazing: you won't get shovel loads of bass, but the low-end is tight
and neutral, while the high-end has a sharpness and timbre above any beyond
anything else we've ever heard.

  * [Read our Audio-Technica DSR9BT review](/headphones/reviews/audio-technica/139169-audio-technica-ath-dsr9bt-review-headphones-audiophile-best-digital-bluetooth)

Pocket-lint

### Master and Dynamic MW65

squirrel_widget_148836

Yes, it's an expensive pair of headphones but they sound fantastic and have
effective active noise cancellation (ANC). They also really look the part,
with premium materials including aluminium and leather. There's no plastic
here.

The downside is that compared to Sony and Bose's ANC models they are
expensive, while some foibles remain such as resonation from walking. However,
the build quality on offer here is absolutely superb and we think they're
brilliant.

[Read our Master and Dynamic MW65 review](/headphones/reviews/148219-master-
and-dynamic-mw65-review-headphones-anc)

Pocket-lint

### Bowers & Wilkins PX

squirrel_widget_142432

The active noise-cancelling wireless headphones market has grown rapidly in
recent times, so it made great sense for Bowers & Wilkins to finally enter.
And it does so in considerable style with the PX, which won Best Headphones in
the Pocket-lint Gadget Awards 2017. B&W comes from a true audiophile
perspective – aptX HD features for Hi-Res Audio without the wires – and the PX
is an excellent high-end alternative to the Bose, Sony and Beats competition
(as also featured), in both style and audio ability terms.

  * [Read our Bowers & Wilkins PX review](/headphones/reviews/bowers-and-wilkins/142432-bowers-and-wilkins-px-review-anc-and-audiophile-talents-combine-in-these-knock-out-over-ears)
